snippet: The ownership ties between a Utah bank and a Ghanaian company raise questions about the role of sanctions.
abstract: New details emerge about American plane owned by Bank of Utah and mysteriously parked in Tehran's airport; document shows that plane has been leased by Ghanaian mining company owned by brother of Ghanaian Pres John Dramani Mahama.

byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett contributed reporting from Washington, Adam Nossiter from Lagos, Nigeria, and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.

lead_paragraph: The ownership ties between a Utah bank and a Ghanaian company raise questions about the role of sanctions.

headline.main: Paper Shows U.S.-Flagged Plane in Iran Has Ties to Ghana
headline.print_headline: Paper Shows U.S.-Flagged Plane in Iran Has Ties to Ghana
